(PIERRE PUTS HIS HAND TO HIS FACE IN
SHOCKED SURPRISE)
JUDGE
(TO PIERRE) How’s this? Why do you
hold your hand up? Have you a toothache,
Master Pierre?
PIERRE
Yes, my teeth are raising such a row
(BACKING OFF) Make him proceed, your
worship.
JUDGE
Go on. Finish your charge.
DRAPER
(TO THE JUDGE) ’tis he and no other.
(TO PIERRE) It was you I sold six yards
of cloth to, Master Pierre.
JUDGE

(TO PIERRE) What is he saying about
cloth? /
PIERRE
(TO THE JUDGE) He’s rambling. He means
to come to the point, but he can’t find
his way to it for he lacks the training.
DRAPER
Hang me, if anybody else took my cloth.
PIERRE p £
(TO JUDGE) How the wretched man lugs
in his inventions to make out a case*
